summary: The document is a status report on Project LIMIX, covering activities from 1 February to 29 February 1968, under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It details various actions taken by LIMIX-1, including the publication and distribution of a political newspaper and an ideological magazine supplement, gathering information from reliable sources, organizing athletic events, and attempting to recover lost TV program time. The report also mentions pending actions, effectiveness indications, administrative notes, security situation, agent meetings, and remarks on the project's focus shifting from student operations to political action and intelligence gathering.
key_findings: LIMIX-1 published a political newspaper and an ideological magazine supplement, distributing them to PRI offices and selected officials.
The project gathered intelligence on political dismissals and expectations within the PRI.
Efforts were made to organize athletic events and youth activities with official support.
A temporary loss of TV programs was attributed to political dismissals, with attempts to recover the time or find alternatives.
The project continued to cultivate relationships with political figures for intelligence gathering and penetration of PRI headquarters.
The report indicates a shift in focus from student operations to political action and intelligence gathering due to leftist agitation.
